title: Theo Walcott’s Arsenal form improved after nailing down wing role, says Arsene Wenger
text:
Theo Walcott has looked more settled on the flank this season (Picture: Getty) Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger has explained how he spoke with Theo Walcott about his best position and discussed how he could improve his game over the summer.
Bizarre scenes at Old Trafford as Phil Jones needs inhaler minutes after coming on The 28-year-old missed out on an England call-up for Euro 2016 after some patchy form for the Gunners, but has been back to his best this season with some memorable performances.
Walcott has 17 goals in all competitions so far this term, and Wenger has revealed he spoke to Wenger about how to improve his game over the summer.
Walcott has 17 goals and 2 assists this season (Picture: Getty) Wenger believes finally settling on playing out wide instead of pushing for a place up front has played a major role in Walcott’s improvement.
‘He is a focused player and was not picked for the European Championship,’ Wenger said. ‘Always in life you try and get to the next level when things don’t go for you or you think you do everything right and continue to live like you did before – and he had the right response.
‘He said “What do I need to do to get higher up?” and he did it.

‘I was always convinced, because of the quality of his runs, that he was a central striker. He for a while was as well but he made up his mind during the summer break and he feels more comfortable on the right.
‘Yes (he told me where he wanted to play). He is fair, he said if you give me the choice I would prefer to play on the right but if you want I will play through the middle.
‘(On the right) is his preferred position, and it is true that it is where he is most efficient.’
